content: this first picture shows the head and horns that I carved out of styrofoam
using hot wire foam factory tools and then I use some finer shaping with
sanding blocks here's a second angle on the head i just
want to show you a different view at this point i have started to add some
detail to the head and what I do is I use caulking just acrylic caulking and I
mix it with a little bit of black acrylic paint and that differentiates it
between the what I've applied and the whiteness of the head so I can kind of
see the detail but you can see some of the details starting to come in on the
sculpture you can see from this picture that I've
added a lot of detail to the head one of the most prominent things though you may
notice are the fins that I've added and those we're actually pretty easy to do
what I did is I cut lengths of wire and then I wrapped them with paper towels
that have we're soaked in glue and then I did the sculpting on it with the
caulking now how I do the sculpting is I squirt some of the caulk on and spread
it and then I use tools to kind of sculpt the caulk onto the surface I'll
use a lot of water with it too to thin it down and you might notice the end of
the fins have some talents or claws on the end and I'll talk about that next
when I go to the next picture in this picture you can see I've got
very far advanced on the scaling just did that with the caulking but above it
you can see some orange pieces or some fleshy colored pieces that look like
horns or spikes that are coming out of the tops of the eyes those were made out
of super sculpt Lee so I just sculpted those and then inserted them into the
head here's a side view of those eye socket horns
here is a front for review of my progress so far here's a close-up of the
sculpting of the gums and teeth you can see those teeth look quite deadly in
this picture if you look between the eye sockets and the fins you will see that
I've added another horn like structure to that area I wanted to fill that in
kind of give it some more dynamics so I added those interesting shaped horns
here I have begun to coat the head with a resin like coding called styro plast
and it makes everything much stronger and durable these pictures show that I
have the entire head covered with the styro plast to give it strength
including the teeth and you'll notice from the other pictures here that I have
hollowed out the skull and you can see through the eye sockets and nose because
i'm going to use this as a wall sconce and i want the light to shine through so
that's why i hollowed out the skull in this picture you can see i have a caller
for the dragon and the purpose of this was to jut the head out from the wall so
the light could shine underneath it and here it is in progress after sculpting
the detail on the collar the neck area like I did with the rest of the dragon
you can see some that underneath the dragon head itself I attached it by
inserting long nails through the collar which is styrofoam into the skull and
then securing it so it all became one piece and here it is finished with the
styro plasti plied this is a picture of the dragon head base painted just flat
black so I can start my painting process jumping ahead a bit here but here is the
head totally painted you can see the eyes are still missing but the paint job
is all hand painted none of it is airbrushed it's all painted by hand
here is the painted dragon head the eyes are still not inserted but you can see
it's a nice scale to the dragon head as you can see it compared to me so there
we go that's the scale of the head here are the eyes for the dragon and to make
these I just cut these almond shapes out of a plastic globe that I got at the
hardware store I use a dremel tool with the rotary blade head to cut these out
and then I hand painted the I details on the on the eyes here are the eyes
inserted into the head to secure them to the head what I did was for the open
cavity what i did was i I drilled little holes in the edges of the eyes and then
put miniature screws in each end to hold the I securely into the socket
here is a walk up to the dragon head wall sconce purchase at the end of my
hall menacing any who passed by you
here is the dragon at night even more ominous and foreboding and the red light
really gives it a creepy look you
